oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electronic Pair-Binding and Hund's Rule Violations in Doped $C_{60}$
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jiang, Hong-Chen
Kivelson, Steven
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Strongly Correlated Electrons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We calculate the electronic properties of the $t$-$J$ model on a $C_{60}$ molecule using the density-matrix renormalization group and show that Hund's first rule is violated and that for an average of three added electron per molecule, an effective attraction (pair-binding) arises for intermediate values of $t/J$. Specifically, it is energetically favorable to put four electrons on one $C_{60}$ and two on a second rather than putting three on each. Our results show that a dominantly electronic mechanism of superconductivity is possible in doped $C_{60}$.
